channel.title: Forums Decision [IPB vs Vbulletin]
channel.description:
Before I make my final decision i would like to know everyone's opinion on a forums we are currently have a discussion over either getting a Vbulletin or IPB I understand that Vbulletin is probably the most powerful forums but IPB is also good for skins and easy all around functionality
Which Of the Above Would you all choose ?

item.title: Forums Decision [IPB vs Vbulletin]
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:4, topic:460816”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=563590.msg4107529#msg4107529 date=1348168618]

MyBB themes are super easy too. Personally I think either of the two is a good choice, just not VB… never looked at IPB

IPB is just generally a pain in the arse. It revolves highly around Ajax and runs a lot slower than other softwares such as SMF and vBulletin.
[/quote]you answered your own statement. IPB runs slow because of ajax[/quote]

I was merely stating why it would run slow, lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Forums Decision [IPB vs Vbulletin]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

… admin cp? Almost all softwares have that… try smf or mybb, both come with a lot of features already and a decent admin CP, and see if they are missing anything that you’d want in VB.

Read full topic

item.title: Forums Decision [IPB vs Vbulletin]
item.dc:creator: @TimeRS3 TimeRS3
item.description:
@TimeRS3 wrote:

im have used phbb we made all our features but no one really has the time to do that anymore now a days so since ipb and vb both are very flexible in using im thinking we would be better off using a forums with adminCP easy all around so we can get the job done fast

Read full topic

item.title: Forums Decision [IPB vs Vbulletin]
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Davidi2:

If you’re using SSI in SMF themes you’re doing it wrong… very wrong

I worded that wrong, those were supposed to be separate statements. The SSI is extremely useful, creating themes in SMF is also very easy since with the layer system.

Read full topic

item.title: Forums Decision [IPB vs Vbulletin]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

If you’re using SSI in SMF themes you’re doing it wrong… very wrong

Read full topic

item.title: Forums Decision [IPB vs Vbulletin]
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Davidi2:

Well I’m not ‘so set on mybb’ either. I just said it was an option. The main difference between MyBB and SMF though is that MyBB has the majority of the features SMF has, plus some extra, but it’s open source and has a super easy to understand modifaction system, whereas SMF does not. SSI is useful, but only in some situations and MyBB has different ways to do the exact same things with mods.

I’ve never really looked into MyBB if I’m honest. I’ve only recently really started using and editing the functions in the SSI and it is extremely useful, especially when working with SMF themes since they’re pretty simple to make.

Read full topic

item.title: Forums Decision [IPB vs Vbulletin]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:23, topic:460656”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=563590.msg4107483#msg4107483 date=1348164718]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=563590.msg4107384#msg4107384 date=1348155939]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=563590.msg4107381#msg4107381 date=1348155854]

Neither!

https://www.phpbb.com/
[/quote]I’ve used this before, I don’t suggest it unless you have a lot of time to develop your own features.

It’s kinda like the ‘elitist’ version of forum software
[/quote]Well in a sense so is IPB/VB (mostly VB). There are some “decent” items out there to add on to it but most of it has to be developed your own self.
[/quote]Not even close to phpbb.

Why are you so set on phpbb, Davidi2? What does phpbb offer over SMF? Especially with SMF offering the SSI.[/quote][quote=“Davidi2, post:20, topic:460656”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=563590.msg4107322#msg4107322 date=1348144873]
Neither!

https://www.phpbb.com/
[/quote]I’ve used this before, [size=36pt]I don’t suggest it[/size][/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Forums Decision [IPB vs Vbulletin]
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

I don’t find IPB to be for RSPS communities, we don’t need to be THAT professional. And vBulletin must and might be the most customizable software that I know of.

SMF is decent for a time-period, however, for the long-run, I would use vBulletin.

Read full topic

item.title: Forums Decision [IPB vs Vbulletin]
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

TimeRS3:

we have more then a basic knowledge for php so i think vbulletin is what i might be getting into then still more info is needed though

You don’t need to know any PHP for making great forums using vBulletin. Everything is included in the AdminCP or is released in modifications.

If you’re decent with PHP, use SMF.

Read full topic
